page.title: 15DUFTON BARYTES MINE
page.content: High on the fells above Dufton are the old lead mines.The spoil-heaps are now being reworked for their barytes content.This is a valuable mineral used in the oil-drilling industry. The main working now takes place on the bleak & windy fellside at about 600m OD.The climate is severe & causes great difficulties to the operators as it is extremely cold at this height in winter.Even during the summer it is often unpleasantly cold,misty & wet. The mine is reached by a long,steep & very rough track over open country & along the side of a narrow,rocky valley.The track is often destroyed by rain & landslips & has to be continually remade to allow the passage of the heavy ore-carrying vehicles down to the village,across the village green to a depot beyond.
